text: >Painted Hills hot dogs, crunchy potato chips and cheddar cheese on a ketchup sauce base
Hey guys, pizza is here. We’ll meet in Courtyard shortly.

attachments.title: Arab Documentary Photography Program
attachments.text: Arab Documentary Photography Project (ADPP) is an initiative that provides support and mentorship to photographers from across the Arab region. The Arab Fund for Arts and Culture in partnership with Magnum Foundation and the Prince Claus Fund established the ADPP to stimulate compelling work by Arab Photographers working across a range of experimental styles of storytelling.

text:
Official Websites
Magnum Foundation – <http://magnumfoundation.org>
Prince Claus Fund –  <http://magnumfoundation.org>
AFAC – <http://www.arabculturefund.org>

Official Twitter Accounts 
Magnum Foundation – @MagnumFND
Prince Claus Fund – @princeclausfund
AFAC – @AFAC1

Official Facebook Pages
Magnum Foundation – <https://www.fb.com/magnumfoundation>
Prince Claus Fund – <https://www.fb.com/princeclausfund>
AFAC – <https://www.fb.com/afac.grants>

text: anything you learned that we should pay attention to? how far is too far, fixed vs percentage, etc?
i think this is looking perfect though, color me impressed.
Thanks. Long story short, we had given padding to the wrong container. Still WIP but  it looks like fixed may work for desktop.
i assume horizontals (for those “safe-zones”) act just like most of our previous horizontals? Like, we can switch to different gridlines, etc.?

*Video*
*What is the status of getting the video assets?*

After talking with Emma about this, there are only two videos from the 2015 grantees (year 1) that will be included in the website. They both are from Natalie’s project.  

<https://vimeo.com/135913711>
<https://vimeo.com/135913668>

Both of the above videos are password protected for now. The password is “ADPP”. 

The videos are both for Natalie’s project “Our Limbo” and should fall into the sequence of images in the following places. Sima – this video should come between images 13 and 14 in the sequence. Tala’s Hope – This video should come between images 37 and 38 in the sequence. 

*Translations*
*Some of the translations sent over do not correspond to the original project names we have. In addition, two projects are missing (Amira Al-Sharif's "A Love Song to Socotra Island", Hamada ElRasam's "Traces of Conflict") from the table. Could you clarify if we should utilize the titles and translations from the table or if we should stick to the titles originally provided?*

A yes, the titles for Amira and Hamada’s projects changed from the translations that we sent to you. Below are the final titles. I am getting translations for these two remaining titles now. Will send along once I have them. 

Faisal Al Fouzan – “Friday Gathering”
Amira Al-Sharif – “A Love Song to Socotra Island”
Hamada ElRasam – “Traces of the Conflict”
Reem Falaknaz – “The Place of Perpetual Undulation”
Samar Hazboun – “Beyond Checkpoints”
Eman Helal – “Just Stop”
Omar Imam – “Live, Love, Refugee”
Natalie Naccache – “Our Limbo”
Zara Samiry – “Tales of Moroccan Amazons"
<@U04JZANJF> can you forward this email to me?
<@U026PLK4S> Quick q: Where do we want to vertically place a project’s Arab name? I see specs for the title and author and was wondering if we have a similar rule for the Arab name.

<!channel> we've got six projects with real content up in the staging CMS. They all have at least a couple slides uploaded and all other info like bios, location, artist headshot, etc., so it should be enough to get a solid start on QA. So let's start using staging <http://staging.arabdocphotography.org/> exclusively from now on. Let me know if I missed anything!

text: <@U0260V1BX|melissa> pinned a message to this channel.
<@U0260V1BX|melissa> pinned a message to this channel.
hey Gaston, I say we tackle that when we jam on the title/author spacing. (and i’m looking at Dev with the height fixes)
but, as a general idea, we want it to be right-aligned with that last column-line, and we want similar whitespace to what we’ve got between title/author.
Cool. Hard to explain why but that one is a tricky one so I’d love for us to tackle that one together.
i think we should get in a room when you’re ready to adjust title/author/arabic, my gut tells me it’s going to be different than what we spec’d based on what you’ve got cooking in dev
toss the “grey background” into that mix as well.
<@U026PLK4S> do you have a preferred style for text links? <https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/spa/ra93brplpldred1/5i1_i7_p.png>
